Subject: [sfraves] Coda - BM Sound Camp Fundraiser - This Saturday at Shine


I don't know how many of you are planning to go to BM this year -
or, for that matter are planning to attend any other fundraisers or
UG events this weekend - but the following event certainly seems
to be a top-shelf event - both Dragnfly and Ron/E have musically taken
me "there" many times over the years - and the word on Jason Knight
is that his skills are currently at a "must be heard to be believed" level.

The price is right, the cause is right, the people and the vibe should
be right, so . . . . . .

Jim Cyr



>Saturday, May 5
>Coda Fundraiser ~ A Burning Man Music Camp
>www.codasf.com
>
>We need you and we need you badly!!!  Come out this
>Saturday night and show the love for DJ's Jason Knight

>Camp =AD bringing progressive music to the Burning Man
>experience.  Special guest DJ Drangfly will be gracing
>the decks. She brings a refreshing blend of
>progressively hard banging tech-trance with an
>"aggressive-as-hell" mixing style.
>
>Here are the deets...
>Saturday, May 5
>9:00 pm - 2:00 am
>Shine, 1337 Mission St | San Francisco | 415-255-1337
>|www.shinesf.com
>$8 at the door, $10 if you would like to donate $2
>towards offsetting greenhouse gas emissions from
>Burning Man 2007.  Donations will be made directly to
>TerraPass where you can balance it out.
>www.terrapass.com.
>
>DJ's for the evening:
>12:15 =AD 2        Ron/e [FiX]
>10:45 =AD 12:15 Dragnfly [www.djdragnfly.com]
>9 =AD 10:45        Jason Knight [djjasonknight.com]
>

>drink a double for an extra dollar.

  Sup yalls!!!
  My girlfriend and I are SO excited right now!!! We are going to Barcelona for two weeks in June for the Sonar Festival. I have not heard of many of the DJ’s spinning and would like some recommendations. The set list is posted below. Also, we have accommodations for the first week, but are deciding what to do with our second week, Ibiza per chance, go up the coast to the Dali museum, or maybe Nerja. (I have heard mixed reviews of Ibiza, what’s u r 2 cents?) If you have been to sonar, Ibiza, or Barcelona let me know what you enjoyed, where you stayed. An amazing write up, like the one for Berlin, would be nice, but not needed. Only a check this spot foo!
   
  
  eddie b. & Laura

Saturday, May 5th

[ K O N T R O L ]

minimal techno + avant house
every first Saturday at the Endup


featuring from Montreal:

STEPHEN BEAUPR=C9  - Live PA
(Musique Risqu=E9e . Mutek_Rec . ~scape . Force Inc.)

As DJ, producer, MUTEK veteran, and half of the Crackhaus project (alongsid=
e
Deadbeat), Stephen Beaupr=E9 has been an integral member of Montreal's vibr=
ant
electronic music scene for over a decade. His sound splices together the
best of funky cut-up house and bumping minimal techno with a playful, sharp
wit that has delighted both chin-strokers and dancefloors worldwide.


and from New York City:

AMBIVALENT -  Live PA
(M-nus . Clink . Klikhaus . Leftroom . Esparanza)

Kevin McHugh (aka Ambivalent) is a rapidly rising star in the world of
neu-techno and the latest addition to the Minus family of artists.  His
dark, sleazy, and intense musical stylings, epitomized by his current hit "=
R
U OK", make this SF debut a must-see for fans of Troy Pierce, Heartthrob,
and the heavier Minus sound.


plus special guest:

GUTHRIE MILLER  ( tweekin' records . integral concepts )


and resident DJs:

NIKOLA BAYTALA   ( robsoul . junior boys own . s.w.a.t. )
SAMMY D   ( classic . dirtybird . utensil )
CRAIG KUNA   ( concept sf . esdjco )
ALLAND BYALLO   ( liebe detail . floppy funk . mo's ferry )

________________________________________________

The ENDUP
401 6th St @ Harrison, SF
10pm - 6am / 21+ / $15
http://www.theendup.com

FREE until 11pm!

________________________________________________

Full bios, pics and lots FREE music:
http://www.kontrolsf.com

[KONTROL] on MySpace:
http://www.myspace.com/kontrolsf

Flyer front:
http://www.kontrolsf.com/K23F.jpg
Flyer back:
http://www.kontrolsf.com/K23B.jpg
Poster:
http://www.kontrolsf.com/K23P.jpg

_________________________________________________


STEPHEN BEAUPR=C9

Based out of Montreal, Stephen Beaupr=E9 has been involved in the electroni=
c
music scene for more than a decade. Cutting his teeth as an adolescent
promoter for electronic music events in Ottawa, Stephen became quickly
seduced by the more substantial rhythms and textures of house and techno
that was striving to be deeper, funkier and more engaging. He began DJing a=
t
18, always with a mind for the dancefloor, always trying to stay close to
the crowd. With a love for gritty, punchy music at once technological and
organic, Stephen skillfully mixes dancefloor rocking tracks, always trying
to create an atmosphere of humor, excitement and malaise.

As a Producer, Stephen Beaupr=E9 creates much more diverse musical
compositions of disected house/tech. With more emphasis on narrative and
multiple changes in direction, the blend of nervous rhythms and dominant
basslines drive forward melodies created from quirky sources linked togethe=
r
by idyosyncratic threads that sometimes touch very deep. His first solo 12
inch "Dirty Lipreading" came out in 2004 on Musique Risqu=E9e, followed in
2006 by the "Macro-house EP" on ~scape and his first solo full length album=
,
"Foe Destroyer" released on both Musique Risqu=E9e (LP) and Mutek_Rec (CD).
He has (alone and with Crackhaus production partner Deadbeat) produced
remixes for Perlon, Force Inc., and Kalimari, and his works have been
featured in several compliations and mixes, including Akufen's "Fabric 17".

Over the past several years, Stephen has toured in four continents, both
solo and with Scott Monteith as "Crackhaus", dropping down in such cities a=
s
Tokyo, Berlin, Beijing, Detroit, Valparaiso, Mexico City, Paris and New Yor=
k
to name a few, and playing alongside such luminaries as Matthew Herbert,
Richie Hawtin, Ricardo Villalobos, Pole, Isol=E9e and many other like-minde=
d
artists.  This will be his first performance ever in San Francisco!


Discography:
http://www.discogs.com/artist/Stephen%20Beaupr%C3%A9

Stephen on MySpace: (with music)
http://www.myspace.com/stephenbeaupre

Music reviews on ForcedExposure.com
http://www.forcedexposure.com/artists/beaupre.stephen.html


________________________________________________


AMBIVALENT

Kevin McHugh (aka Ambivalent) is a native of Washington, DC and resident of
New York City. His musical development began in DC where he was influenced
by the broad nature of that city's music scene. Early exposure to acid-hous=
e
and industrial side-by-side with DC's homegrown go-go and hardcore punk
scenes deeply influenced his music.

After a brief period in London, Kevin moved to New York in 1996. He began
producing a music series inside the Brooklyn Bridge Anchorage for Creative
Time. Over the next 5 years he produced events with artists such as Thomas
Brinkmann, Dimbiman, Carl Craig, Ryoji Ikeda, Pole, and many more. It was
during this time that he began making a connection with M-nus. He went on t=
o
produce events in New York featuring friends such as Magda, Troy Pierce and
his roommate Jesse Siminski (Heartthrob) as well as Matthew Dear, Akufen an=
d
Sammy Dee.

He moved to Berlin in 2004 to help Richie Hawtin produce the Plastikman liv=
e
concert. He later returned to New York and re-dedicated himself to producin=
g
music inspired by his friends. He answered an ad for an apartment, and move=
d
in with a DJ named Camea. She later created Clink Recordings. He DJs
regularly in New York, and on his internet radio show, The Nerd Tank, with
Camea. He has releases and remixes (past and forthcoming) on M-nus, Clink,
Klickhaus, Esperanza, and Leftroom.

The near future is looking very bright for Ambivalent. In addition to being
invited to play live at this year's MUTEK Festival, Kevin has just released
his debut 12" on M-nus entitled "R U OK", the title track of which has
already been selected for inclusion on the upcoming Best of Minus
compilation "Nothing Much", to be released June 1st.


Discography:
http://www.discogs.com/artist/Ambivalent

Ambivalent on MySpace:
http://www.myspace.com/iamambivalent

Music samples + a review of R U OK:
http://www.soulseduction.com/common/item_detail.php?ItemID=3D171456

R U OK teaser video by M-nus:
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3DoJr6ohRB-h4

Recent interview with Ambivalent on Rhythmism.com:
http://www.rhythmism.com/features/?id=3D246


________________________________________________


GUTHRIE MILLER

Guthrie has been the main music buyer at Tweekin' Records for years, playin=
g
a heavy behind-the-scenes role as musical tastemaker in the Bay. Prior to
that he was the man behind Integral Concepts, an SF monthly techno staple i=
n
the millenial era that featured atists such as Frankie Bones, Hyperactive,
and Andrei Morant.  His extensive collection of classics, coupled with his
access to the freshest new tracks, make this appearance sure to be an early
morning treat.


Tweekin' Website:
http://www.tweekin.com

Guthrie on Myspace:
http://profile.myspace.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=3Duser.viewprofile&friendid=
=3D18538705


________________________________________________

http://www.kontrolsf.com

Subject: [sfraves] Updates on Adrianna & Apollo

So i went to the hospital in Berk tonight ot visit Adrianna & she's in
mondo recovery!!!  1st of, Peter, i guess she checked her email on her
cell phone 'cause she saw you wre worried about her & says thanks!  She
also says Thanks to everyone who sent out Groovy vibes to her.. basically,
he body is like detoxing from all the yucky that internally spilled from
the "injured" large intestine that "accidentally" got a hole poked in her
1st operation... so like there's heeeella like bags & stuff of different
fluid draining from her body, but she's in good spirits!  We had a few
good laughs in her room!

Oooooooooooh.. so the lady next to her in the other bed was in mondo
pain.. had like this back surgery & well.. i duuunno why they put her in a
room & not leave her in the recovery room after her surgery.. but she was
literally screaming bloody murder & yelling to God to kill her, she was in
so much pain... so for the 1st hour of hangin out, all we heard was her
yelliing & it was hard not to laugh, but the truck driver talk that came
outta this lady's mouth was intense (& that's seriously putting it mildly)
until see.. she also has a high tolerance to morphine, so no matter how
much she would take, it wasn't enough.. so finally, when the doctor
finally arrived to help her & administered a proper amount of morphine in
her... it ended up being too much & kinda slowed her heart down, but she
passed through that & finally fell asleep... anywaze.. that lady's son &
daughter like we got to talking... ended up that me & the son went to
Elementary together & he was actually part of the "CooL crowd" when we wre
in grade school/ jr high!  Turns out the Daughter went to Elementary w/ my
Older sis... lol.. so that was funny!  Also on the same floor... i bumped
into my Auntie who i haven't seen in years & we even talked for quite a
while!!!  She gave me food while i was w/ Adrianna 'cause I was hungry!!! 
So i was eating infront of Unka knowing she couldn't eat anythning, well..
orally anyway... lol... Hello 2eday... but yeah!

So yeah, She's getting better & dealing w/ high tempuratures & stuff
'cause all the yucky inside her body, but she's getting better & send her
Love to y'all!!

As for Apollo, I just got word earlier that he's making a Supder Awesome
comeback!  He's getting stronger & recovering well!
--

Andrew Phelan <mailinglists@djandrewphelan.com> wrote: Ready for an evening of rippin' tech house and electro that won't stop until
the break of dawn? This underground event is the perfect way to celebrate
Drinko De Mayo, with a lineup that will blow the sombreros off of your head
from start to finish! Arrive early for a discount and to ensure admission as
this is a limited capacity event that will definitely sell out. 

Saturday, May 5th 
10 PM until super late 
Rock It Science presents: 
Drinko De Mayo! 
Call 415.412.0406 or 888.482.9281 the night of for directions 
Cover: $5 before 10:30, $10 before midnight, $15 after 

DJ's/Live Acts: 
The Fingermonsters (Live)
Don't miss the underground premier of SF's sickest live Tech House act!
The Fingermonsters are Shazbot, Origami, Cubik, and Andrew Phelan 

Ladyhouse (Femme DJ's, Minx)
Special Birthday set! 

Leonard (Tocadisco, InHouse)
Master of the vinyl stylings, Leonard's closing sets are always crowd
pleasing. 

Eric Sharp (Rock It Science, Minx)
Banging out the gritty stylings to work you out!

Worthy (Dirty Bird, Katabatic)
Hot up and coming dirty bird whose jams will get the dancefloor pumping.
Prepare... 

Native Intelligence (Rock It Science, Sleevin)
Setting the tone just right for the evening, arrive early to catch a kickass
opener! 

Call the info line on Saturday and don't forget your dancing shoes. Fiesta!

Subject: Re: [sfraves] PARTY REVIEWS?

--0-145129753-1178120843=:33817
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=iso-8859-1
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

We hit up Filter @ Fat City then Tonal later that night. Fat City was aight, I met this dude Ray that was involved with it and he seemed like a really cool cat. The lineup was pretty solid, and I was sad to see that there weren't more people there. Took advantage of the drink specials. . . 

TONAL WAS SWEET! We got there around 1:00 right before the second "after club" wave rolled through. Nothing but smiles from the staff, and I got a tight ass CD at the door for wearing my purple skull shirt. I'd say the turnout was pretty good- the floor was full but there was still plenty of room to dance. The spot was really cool too, and they let us sesh in an adjacent room. The crowd was a great mix, lots of friendly folks from all walks of life (pardon the cliche), and my buddy hooked up with someone, so that's always a good sign. Andrew & Greg had a rockin set. 

Thanks again guys, can't wait for the next one. 

peace
chuck

dangrsmind@yahoo.com wrote: Ok, I didn't go out last weekend, but I bet *YOU* did.  Where's the party review and incriminating photographs?  :P

Peace,

Peter

Subject: Re: [sfraves] Aaron Jae on XM Radio

Thump funk is one of the better shows on XM..

Sirius has a way better programming section, and since they have merged I 
hope to get sirius channel shortly. On Redbull on the "Move" and thumpFunk 
are the two best programs on air right now. I think thumpfunk is on BPM I 
could be mistaken??

Shows they need to kill on XM are: Deeper shades of house. Keep in mind I 
love deep house but Lar's show is just the most boring house you can 
imagine. With the exception of when he has guest mixes turned in. Some of 
the guest play some groovy soulful "SF" style house.. You know that drop 
music kind of sound.

Lil Louie Vegas show: I mean come on afro cuban house mixed with jazz.. He 
needs to be on the "Chill" station not a house programmed station. To loungy 
and just out there for me. It's like KKSF with a 4/4 background just to keep 
it in the house vein.

Then you have the extreme with "The System" which plays the worst of the 
worse in trance and NRG. It's like being hopped up on 24 pill and a line of 
some Crystal just to get through it..


So needless to say there is not real middle ground with XM you have really 
bad, really boring sprinkled with some solid shows..


Thanks for reading my XM rant  :-)


Macadio

Subject: [sfraves] BSP: Mike Relm, Evil Nine and Evil Breaks at 1015 - Friday

Evil Breaks, An-Ten-Nae.net, and the Fringe present:

A Mayday Revolution

May 4th, 2007
@ 1015 Folsom
10pm-5am
21+

We've got the lineup and team up of the Year!! Along with some of the
most wicked performers ever, 1015 will be decorated to the hilt with a
giant TV wall in the main room, outlandish decor by Laurel of
Raindance, performance art, and $5 bloody mary's all night. This is
definitely a show you're not going to want to miss.


AREA 1:
Evil 9 - Marine Parade UK
Mike Relm - mikerelm.com
Motion Potion - Fringe
Aaron Jae - Evil Breaks/XM/Space Cowboys (3-Close Main Room)

AREA 2:
The Glitch Mob - Featuring Kraddy & Ooah

AREA 3:
Dov - Muti

Victor Vega - Fringe

AREA 4:
M3 - Green Gorilla
Monty Luke - Diskotronik
Rooz & Rouzbeh - Back2BasicsSF

$10 before 11pm email info@evilbreaks.com or show up b4 11 wearing all red.
$15 presales @ www.wantickets.com/1015
$20 door unless you get on the list & arrive before 11pm.

www.EvilBreaks.com
www.An-Ten-nae.net

----- Original Message ----
From: Macadio G. <macadio@hotmail.com>
To: invibe@gmail.com; dangrsmind@yahoo.com
Cc: sfraves@hyperreal.org
Sent: Wednesday, May 2, 2007 8:58:05 AM
Subject: Re: [sfraves] Aaron Jae on XM Radio


Thump funk is one of the better shows on XM..

Sirius has a way better programming section, and since they have merged I 
hope to get sirius channel shortly. On Redbull on the "Move" and thumpFunk 
are the two best programs on air right now. I think thumpfunk is on BPM I 
could be mistaken??

Shows they need to kill on XM are: Deeper shades of house. Keep in mind I 
love deep house but Lar's show is just the most boring house you can 
imagine. With the exception of when he has guest mixes turned in. Some of 
the guest play some groovy soulful "SF" style house.. You know that drop 
music kind of sound.

Lil Louie Vegas show: I mean come on afro cuban house mixed with jazz.. He 
needs to be on the "Chill" station not a house programmed station. To loungy 
and just out there for me. It's like KKSF with a 4/4 background just to keep 
it in the house vein.

Then you have the extreme with "The System" which plays the worst of the 
worse in trance and NRG. It's like being hopped up on 24 pill and a line of 
some Crystal just to get through it..


So needless to say there is not real middle ground with XM you have really 
bad, really boring sprinkled with some solid shows..


Thanks for reading my XM rant  :-)


Macadio

Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit
X-Priority: 3 (Normal)
Importance: Normal
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: [sfraves] NRR: Crossroads & I shaved my head :n)

ok... so like about 2 months ago... I found my Mom's journal of when i got
into my car accident & like the months/ years that followed it... like
seriously ya know.. like when i was 21, my Dad let me read the Doctor's
reports of when he performed that surgery on me... ok.. well.. long story
short... when i "died" then they brought me back to life, my brain was
like pumping or seomthing... anuerism I thnk it's called... so to relieve
the "stress", the doctor like made 6 holes in my skull that have hardened
alot since... I've always had my hair to like cover most of the dents, but
since reading my Mom's journal again after all these years, I've had the
itch to shave off my whole head of hair to see what I hiding.. 'cause I
mean, it's time & well.. for other reasons like just letting go of alota
yucky & starting fresh, went from:

http://i131.photobucket.com/albums/p314/OsbyWonka/P4300129.jpg

to

http://i131.photobucket.com/albums/p314/OsbyWonka/P4300136.jpg

to

http://i131.photobucket.com/albums/p314/OsbyWonka/P4300138.jpg

to

http://i131.photobucket.com/albums/p314/OsbyWonka/P4300140.jpg

to

http://i131.photobucket.com/albums/p314/OsbyWonka/P4300147.jpg
http://i131.photobucket.com/albums/p314/OsbyWonka/P4300141.jpg

to

http://i131.photobucket.com/albums/p314/OsbyWonka/P4300149.jpg
http://i131.photobucket.com/albums/p314/OsbyWonka/P4300142.jpg

to

http://i131.photobucket.com/albums/p314/OsbyWonka/P4300155.jpg
http://i131.photobucket.com/albums/p314/OsbyWonka/P4300161.jpg
http://i131.photobucket.com/albums/p314/OsbyWonka/P4300159.jpg
http://i131.photobucket.com/albums/p314/OsbyWonka/P4300163.jpg

So, sorry for the OD on pixes.. but yeah... lately I been feeling like i
dunno... i mean... y'all know i'm confuzed 24/7 anywazy.. but I dunno... I
wanted to feel free, so i shaved my head & actually have felt lifts in my
emotions from it & yeah...

It's kinda trippy too man... these scars, dents, bumps & stitches all up
on my head... I Love them!!!  I mean.. i'm not a bald person.. i don't
think i can pull this look off all too well.. LoL.. Hello 2day... but
yeah... this also like erases fears I've had about other people seeing my
deformed fucked up skull 'cause ya know... i mean.. i took some time.. but
i'm proud of this fucked up head I got now!!! :)

I been slowly show all mi familia on the net this new thing i got goin' on
& yeah... it's interesting to say the least!  Hello 2day!!  Hello
2Britney!

Love U SFR!


-- 
Take Care <3
Peace=->Jus' Me =-> O§bY {8O)

Saw Apollo tonight - it's really too early to tell how he's
doing, so I hesitate to speculate based solely off of
appearances.

They're running more tests - let's send positive thoughts his
way.  If anyone can bounce back, it's Apollo.

Joey is reading all e-mails to Apollo that are sent to
eagleqr@speakeasy.org.  I know he's doing better because of the
love and support from the community.

So please, take a moment and reflect on a positive impact
Apollo has had on your life.  Maybe it's thru his writing, his
advice, his presence at one of the parties you've attended, or
one of the Moksha Parties he's thrown.  And if you're so
inclined, please send it to Joey.

It really will make a difference.

Love, and a speedy recovery to you, Apollo.

  *All You Need Is Love
*

<http://www.emailbrain.com/sendlink.asp?HitID=1178137499000&StID=16491&SID=1&EmID=44058921&Link=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.groovetickets.com%2Fbz_art_new.asp%3FDID%3D1369>At
this point, *Go Ventures'* annual *Love Festival* is downright historic.
Established in *LA* in *September *of 1992, the dance music institution has
drawn past-capacity crowds every year of its existence, and has even
traveled the world, to places as diverse as *Denver, Japan, Mexico, Hawaii,
Las Vegas,* etc. In fact, *Love Fest *is the longest-running annual dance
music festival in all *North America*. So there's no time like the present
to come out and be a part of it. This year's installment (its 15th) goes
down *Saturday, May 26th* at *The Los Angeles Memorial Coliseum/Expo Gardens
*, and looks to be as insane as ever, with nine solid hours of dance music
bliss. Love a little...

  *Party Existence
*

<http://www.emailbrain.com/sendlink.asp?HitID=1178137499000&StID=16491&SID=1&EmID=44058921&Link=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.groovetickets.com%2Fbz_art_new.asp%3FDID%3D1365>The
folks at* I.T. Family* still like to get existential with their
celebrations, and why not? One of 2006's raddest events is returning for
another round: *Existence*. This year's incarnation has been organized as a
three day festival of "music, fun, and festivitiez." More than 70 top DJs
have been booked across seven areas of sound. Also, the location for *
Existence* is of course TBA, but it will take place in a "top secret
enchanted forest" (situated only 20 minutes outside *LA*). Like, literally a
forest. So mark your calendar for the weekend of *Friday, Saturday*, and *
Sunday* *May 4th-6th*, and get ready...

  *Burning Sensations
*

<http://www.emailbrain.com/sendlink.asp?HitID=1178137499000&StID=16491&SID=1&EmID=44058921&Link=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.groovetickets.com%2Fbz_art_new.asp%3FDID%3D1379>This
has got to be one the greatest, double entendre-packing party titles of all
time. It functions on so many different levels, it's genius. And at its
root, it's still just a really solid party. Thrown by the folks at *Session,
Burning Sensations* is going down *Saturday, May 5th* at the one and
only *Circus
Disco* in *Hollywood, California*, and features a trio of top-tier DJs, all
of whom are well beyond worth of your time/attention/money: *Ronald Van
Gelderen*, plus resident kings *Victor Dinaire* and *Jonathan Morning*.
Doors open at nine PM and close at five AM, so you've got all kinds of time
to burn up the dance floor and stir up some meaningful (aka "burning")
sensations. Come out and play...

*// CLICK HERE TO
CONTINUE<http://www.emailbrain.com/sendlink.asp?HitID=1178137499000&StID=16491&SID=1&EmID=44058921&Link=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.groovetickets.com%2Fbz_art_new.asp%3FDID%3D1379>
*




  *From Autumn to Awesome
*

<http://www.emailbrain.com/sendlink.asp?HitID=1178137499000&StID=16491&SID=1&EmID=44058921&Link=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.groovetickets.com%2Fbz_art_new.asp%3FDID%3D1377>Most
*Midwest* punks know *Skelletones*, the long-running, all-ages rock & roll
headquarters situated in downtown *Grand Rapids, Michigan*. They book all
today's premier purveyors of next-wave screamo, thrash, hardcore, grind,
punk, pop, etc. And *Wednesday, May 2nd* they're bringing a real circus to
town, starring *Long Island's* "melodic hardcore" masters *From Autumn to
Ashes* and *Indianapolis*-based *Christian* screamers *Haste the Day*, plus
*Twelve Gauge Valentine, Maylene* and *The Sons of Disaster*. Drugs/booze
are banned, but headbanging, riffs, sweat, and black t-shirts are
encouraged. Expect purposeful moshing and a furious youth-quake...

CONTINUE<http://www.emailbrain.com/sendlink.asp?HitID=1178137499000&StID=16491&SID=1&EmID=44058921&Link=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.groovetickets.com%2Fbz_art_new.asp%3FDID%3D1377>

X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: Re: NRR: Re: [sfraves] The truth about 4/29


UNCOMFORTABLE QUESTIONS ABOUT THE ATTACK: Was it an inside job?

1) Why were a handful of rebel fighters able to penetrate the defenses of a 
battle station that had the capability of destroying an entire planet and 
the defenses to ward off several fleets of battle ships?

2) Why did Grand Moff Tarkin refuse to deploy the station's large fleet of 
TIE Fighters until it was too late? Was he acting on orders from somebody 
to not shoot down the rebel attack force? If so, who, and why?

3) Why was the rebel pilot who supposedly destroyed the Death Star reported 
to be on the Death Star days, maybe hours, prior to its destruction? Why 
was he allowed to escape, and why were several individuals dressed in 
Stormtrooper uniforms seen helping him?

4) Why has there not been an investigation into allegations that Darth 
Vader, the second-ranking member of the Imperial Government, is in fact the 
father of the pilot who allegedly destroyed the Death Star?

5) Why did Lord Vader decide to break all protocols and personally pilot a 
lightly armored TIE Fighter? Conveniently, this placed Lord Vader outside 
of the Death Star when it was destroyed, where he was also conveniently 
able to escape from a large-sized rebel fleet that had just routed the 
Imperial forces. Why would Lord Vader, one of the highest ranking members 
of the Imperial Government, suddenly decide to fly away from the Death Star 
in the middle of a battle? Did he know something that the rest of the 
Imperial Navy didn't?

6) How could any pilot shoot a missile into a 2 meter-wide exhaust port, 
let alone a pilot with no formal training, whose only claim to fame was his 
ability to "bullseye womprats" on Tatooine? This shot, according to one 
pilot, would be "impossible, even for a computer." Yet, according to 
additional evidence, the pilot who allegedly fired the missile turned off 
his targeting computer when he was supposedly firing the shot that 
destroyed the Death Star. Why have these discrepancies never been 
investigated, let alone explained?

7) Why has their been no investigation into evidence that the droids who 
provided the rebels with the Death Star plans were once owned by none other 
than Lord Vader himself, and were found, conveniently, by the pilot who 
destroyed the Death Star, and who is also believed to be Lord Vader's son? 
Evidence also shows that the droids were brought to one Ben Kenobi, who, 
records indicate, was Darth Vader's teacher many years earlier! Are all 
these personal connections between the conspirators and a key figure in the 
Imperial government supposed to be coincidences?

8) How could a single missile destroy a battle station the size of a moon? 
No records, anywhere, show that any battle station or capital ship has ever 
been destroyed by a single missile. Furthermore, analysis of the tape of 
the last moments of the Death Star show numerous small explosions along its 
surface, prior to it exploding completely! Why does all evidence indicate 
that strategically placed explosives, not a single missile, is what 
destroyed the Death Star?

Subject: Re: [sfraves] The truth about 4/29

this site is to mock the truth about 9/11.
"debunkers" are comparing the freeway collapse to the World trade Center 
Collapse and saying that it WAS possible for the two planes and small fire 
to bring down THREE buildings. Which would be the first, second and third 
time in history this has ever happened.

Even though this freeway burned a lot longer, had lower grade steel and did 
not collapse into fine powder as if it was demolished by demolishin 
explosives people still insist that the freeway proves 9/11

I did a horrible job of explaining this, but this link surely will help.

http://prisonplanet.com/articles/may2007/010507ludicrousfreeway.htm

So 4/29 truth does have some valid points but most of it was a joke to mock 
the 9/11 truth movement.

-Mobber-

Subject: Re: [sfraves] The truth about 4/29

Mattier & Ross in this morning's SFChron: Seems that all 12 lugs on  
the wheels of a tanker carrying 8600 gals of gas recently came off in  
Golden Gate Park. Coincidence or conspiracy? You be the judge.

http://www.sfgate.com/cgi-bin/article.cgi?f=/c/a/2007/05/03/ 
BAGFLPJME830.DTL

MATIER AND ROSS
Owner of tanker that lost wheels in Golden Gate Park is investigating  
accident
Phillip Matier, Andrew Ross
Thursday, May 3, 2007

Officials of the fuel-hauling company whose gasoline tanker truck  
lost a pair of wheels in San Francisco's Golden Gate Park last week  
said Wednesday they are stumped over what caused the dangerous mishap  
-- but they are investigating the possibility that someone tampered  
with the vehicle.

The truck, which belongs to KAG West of West Sacramento, lost the  
left front wheels off the tanker on Park Presidio Drive the night of  
April 26, while it was heading for a Shell station with 8,600 gallons  
of gas. San Francisco police didn't take a report because no one was  
hurt in the accident, but a Municipal Railway mechanic whose private  
car was hit by one of the tires, Michael Cheney, said all 10 lug nuts  
on the wheels had come off.

Bruce Redmon, KAG West's safety director, said the 2-year-old truck  
had undergone a routine inspection that night before leaving the  
company's fueling terminal in Martinez. The inspection included  
checking the lug nuts on all the wheels, Redmon said.

"They (the trucks) are checked daily, and this was no exception,''  
Redmon said.

He said he'd been in the trucking business 30 years and this was the  
first time he'd ever heard of a set of tanker wheels simply falling  
off. He said he couldn't predict how long the investigation will take  
to complete.

"It could be today, or 30 days from today, because we want the  
conclusion to be correct,'' he said. As for the possibility of  
tampering, he said: "There is a chance.''

Cheney, who works on Muni buses, said that in his opinion, the lug  
nuts did not appear to have been stripped. That suggests the nuts  
either weren't properly tightened or they were intentionally  
loosened, he said.

So far, police have not gotten involved in the investigation. The  
police officers who responded to the accident were there to make sure  
the truck driver and the drivers of the two cars hit by the wheels  
exchanged information for insurance purposes, and to direct traffic  
around the scene. The California Highway Patrol, which regulates  
tanker trucks on the highways, was never called.

Even though the incident happened on a state highway -- Park Presidio  
is part of Highway 1 -- "there has to be a fatality, injury or tow- 
away (for the CHP to become involved), and this did not comply with  
any of those,'' Redmon said.

He said that both the driver and his company, which operates 225 fuel  
trucks in California, Arizona and Nevada, have "an exemplary record.''

CHP safety officials said a review of KAG West records shows the  
company's Martinez terminal received an "unsatisfactory'' report for  
what was described only as "inadequate repair equipment'' just after  
the firm acquired the facility from another operator in 2003. But the  
company was given a clean bill of health on a return visit four  
months later, and again last year.

Highway Patrol records show that KAG West trucks have been issued 17  
citations in California since Jan. 11, mostly for basic equipment  
violations. But according to Greg Bragg, manager of motor carrier  
safety for the CHP, given the number of trucks KAG West operates,  
"that level of citations is actually a very low rate.''

All aboard: Everyone is working in overdrive to get the collapsed  
portion of the MacArthur Maze fixed -- and to get their share of  
political face time in as well.
And, from what we're told, the effort to generate attention is also  
generating a bit of friction within the Bay Area's heavily Democratic  
political family.

Rep. Ellen Tauscher of Walnut Creek is arranging a big helicopter  
flyover of the accident scene Friday morning, with Caltrans Director  
Will Kempton, Rep. Barbara Lee of Oakland and Rep. James Oberstar of  
Minnesota, chairman of the House Transportation and Infrastructure  
Committee, along for the ride.

Not to be outdone, Sen. Barbara Boxer is planning her own private  
briefing and tour Friday -- accompanied by U.S. Transportation  
Secretary Mary Peters and Caltrans' local boss, Bijan Sartipi.

Boxer plans to finish late in the morning with a big media event near  
the maze, to which she has invited Gov. Arnold Schwarzenegger, San  
Francisco Mayor Gavin Newsom, Oakland Mayor Ron Dellums, Lee and  
Tauscher.

And what about Tauscher's helicopter ride, departing from SFO at  
10:15 a.m. -- less than an hour before the scheduled press conference?

"We are not partaking in the helicopter tour,'' Boxer spokeswoman  
Natalie Ravitz said. "We are told we can survey the damage right  
there on the scene.''

Fine, Tauscher's people insist. But just for the record, they say  
they were planning the maze flyover even before Sunday's collapse, as  
part of an effort to scrape up more federal dollars for Bay Area  
transit.

Bottom line, said Tauscher spokesman Kevin Lawlor: "It's tough to get  
everyone together with their schedules, but hopefully we can at least  
get everyone in one place for the press conference.''

No doubt, no doubt.

EXTRA! Catch our Web page at www.SFGate.com/matierandross. Play the  
dancing George Bush caption contest. Vote for the best option for  
dealing with the MacArthur Maze mess. Check out the bricks and kisses  
in feedback. And read the Extra, Extra, Extra musings and insights of  
friends including Rich "Big Vinny'' Lieberman and The Chronicle's  
Carla Marinucci and Don "Bad Reporter" Asmussen.

Chronicle columnists Phillip Matier and Andrew Ross regularly appear  
Sundays, Mondays and Wednesdays. Phil can be seen on CBS 5-TV morning  
and evening news. Matier can also be heard on KCBS radio Monday to  
Friday at 7:50 a.m. and 5:50 p.m. Got a tip? Call them at (415)  
777-8815 or drop them an e-mail at matierandross@sfchronicle.com.

> briefing and tour Friday -- accompanied by U.S. Transportation  
> Secretary Mary Peters and Caltrans' local boss, Bijan Sartipi.
>
> Boxer plans to finish late in the morning with a big media event  
> near the maze, to which she has invited Gov. Arnold Schwarzenegger,  
> San Francisco Mayor Gavin Newsom, Oakland Mayor Ron Dellums, Lee  
> and Tauscher.
>
> And what about Tauscher's helicopter ride, departing from SFO at  
> 10:15 a.m. -- less than an hour before the scheduled press conference?
>
> "We are not partaking in the helicopter tour,'' Boxer spokeswoman  
> Natalie Ravitz said. "We are told we can survey the damage right  
> there on the scene.''
>
> Fine, Tauscher's people insist. But just for the record, they say  
> they were planning the maze flyover even before Sunday's collapse,  
> as part of an effort to scrape up more federal dollars for Bay Area  
> transit.
>
> Bottom line, said Tauscher spokesman Kevin Lawlor: "It's tough to  
> get everyone together with their schedules, but hopefully we can at  
> least get everyone in one place for the press conference.''
>
> No doubt, no doubt.

Subject: Re: [sfraves] The truth about 4/29

Actually, the use of tankers as in 4/29 and the GGP incident is a well known scenario in security circles. 

People in the government have known about the possible use of gasoline and chemical tankers as weapons for at least a decade, since a tanker was used to attack an Air Force facility in Saudi Arabia in 1996.

I won't elaborate here obviously, but I was involved in an online discusison of some possible terrorist scenarios about a year ago.  The possibility of using tanker trucks to attack economic flows and transportation routes was discussed during that conversation.  

The literature which I am aware of on this goes back at least a decade, dating to the attack in Saudi Arabia.  I expect there are earlier assessments in the classified world.

When I see a tanker on the freeway, I get away from it.  Now you know why.

Peace,

Peter

From: Philip.X.Diaz <st_indigo@earthlink.net>

fossil fuel monkey-wrenching.  look out.


On May 3, 2007, at 9:14 AM, Will Penna wrote:

> Mattier & Ross in this morning's SFChron: Seems that all 12 lugs on  
> the wheels of a tanker carrying 8600 gals of gas recently came off  
> in Golden Gate Park. Coincidence or conspiracy? You be the judge.
>
> http://www.sfgate.com/cgi-bin/article.cgi?f=/c/a/2007/05/03/ 
> BAGFLPJME830.DTL
>
> MATIER AND ROSS
> Owner of tanker that lost wheels in Golden Gate Park is  
> investigating accident
> Phillip Matier, Andrew Ross
> Thursday, May 3, 2007
>
> Officials of the fuel-hauling company whose gasoline tanker truck  
> lost a pair of wheels in San Francisco's Golden Gate Park last week  
> said Wednesday they are stumped over what caused the dangerous  
> mishap -- but they are investigating the possibility that someone  
> tampered with the vehicle.
>
> The truck, which belongs to KAG West of West Sacramento, lost the  
> left front wheels off the tanker on Park Presidio Drive the night  
> of April 26, while it was heading for a Shell station with 8,600  
> gallons of gas. San Francisco police didn't take a report because  
> no one was hurt in the accident, but a Municipal Railway mechanic  
> whose private car was hit by one of the tires, Michael Cheney, said  
> all 10 lug nuts on the wheels had come off.
>
> Bruce Redmon, KAG West's safety director, said the 2-year-old truck  
> had undergone a routine inspection that night before leaving the  
> company's fueling terminal in Martinez. The inspection included  
> checking the lug nuts on all the wheels, Redmon said.
>
> "They (the trucks) are checked daily, and this was no exception,''  
> Redmon said.
>
> He said he'd been in the trucking business 30 years and this was  
> the first time he'd ever heard of a set of tanker wheels simply  
> falling off. He said he couldn't predict how long the investigation  
> will take to complete.
>
> "It could be today, or 30 days from today, because we want the  
> conclusion to be correct,'' he said. As for the possibility of  
> tampering, he said: "There is a chance.''
>
> Cheney, who works on Muni buses, said that in his opinion, the lug  
> nuts did not appear to have been stripped. That suggests the nuts  
> either weren't properly tightened or they were intentionally  
> loosened, he said.
>
> So far, police have not gotten involved in the investigation. The  
> police officers who responded to the accident were there to make  
> sure the truck driver and the drivers of the two cars hit by the  
> wheels exchanged information for insurance purposes, and to direct  
> traffic around the scene. The California Highway Patrol, which  
> regulates tanker trucks on the highways, was never called.
>
> Even though the incident happened on a state highway -- Park  
> Presidio is part of Highway 1 -- "there has to be a fatality,  
> injury or tow-away (for the CHP to become involved), and this did  
> not comply with any of those,'' Redmon said.
>
> He said that both the driver and his company, which operates 225  
> fuel trucks in California, Arizona and Nevada, have "an exemplary  
> record.''
>
> CHP safety officials said a review of KAG West records shows the  
> company's Martinez terminal received an "unsatisfactory'' report  
> for what was described only as "inadequate repair equipment'' just  
> after the firm acquired the facility from another operator in 2003.  
> But the company was given a clean bill of health on a return visit  
> four months later, and again last year.
>
> Highway Patrol records show that KAG West trucks have been issued  
> 17 citations in California since Jan. 11, mostly for basic  
> equipment violations. But according to Greg Bragg, manager of motor  
> carrier safety for the CHP, given the number of trucks KAG West  
> operates, "that level of citations is actually a very low rate.''
>
> All aboard: Everyone is working in overdrive to get the collapsed  
> portion of the MacArthur Maze fixed -- and to get their share of  
> political face time in as well.
> And, from what we're told, the effort to generate attention is also  
> generating a bit of friction within the Bay Area's heavily  
> Democratic political family.
>
> Rep. Ellen Tauscher of Walnut Creek is arranging a big helicopter  
> flyover of the accident scene Friday morning, with Caltrans  
> Director Will Kempton, Rep. Barbara Lee of Oakland and Rep. James  
> Oberstar of Minnesota, chairman of the House Transportation and  
> Infrastructure Committee, along for the ride.
>
> Not to be outdone, Sen. Barbara Boxer is planning her own private  
> briefing and tour Friday -- accompanied by U.S. Transportation  
> Secretary Mary Peters and Caltrans' local boss, Bijan Sartipi.
>
> Boxer plans to finish late in the morning with a big media event  
> near the maze, to which she has invited Gov. Arnold Schwarzenegger,  
> San Francisco Mayor Gavin Newsom, Oakland Mayor Ron Dellums, Lee  
> and Tauscher.
>
> And what about Tauscher's helicopter ride, departing from SFO at  
> 10:15 a.m. -- less than an hour before the scheduled press conference?
>
> "We are not partaking in the helicopter tour,'' Boxer spokeswoman  
> Natalie Ravitz said. "We are told we can survey the damage right  
> there on the scene.''
>
> Fine, Tauscher's people insist. But just for the record, they say  
> they were planning the maze flyover even before Sunday's collapse,  
> as part of an effort to scrape up more federal dollars for Bay Area  
> transit.
>
> Bottom line, said Tauscher spokesman Kevin Lawlor: "It's tough to  
> get everyone together with their schedules, but hopefully we can at  
> least get everyone in one place for the press conference.''
>
> No doubt, no doubt.
>

On May 3, 2007, at 9:20 AM, Philip.X.Diaz wrote:

> fossil fuel monkey-wrenching.  look out.
>
>
> On May 3, 2007, at 9:14 AM, Will Penna wrote:
>
>> Mattier & Ross in this morning's SFChron: Seems that all 12 lugs  
>> on the wheels of a tanker carrying 8600 gals of gas recently came  
>> off in Golden Gate Park. Coincidence or conspiracy? You be the judge.
>>
>> http://www.sfgate.com/cgi-bin/article.cgi?f=/c/a/2007/05/03/ 
>> BAGFLPJME830.DTL
>>
>> MATIER AND ROSS
>> Owner of tanker that lost wheels in Golden Gate Park is  
>> investigating accident
>> Phillip Matier, Andrew Ross
>> Thursday, May 3, 2007
>>
>> Officials of the fuel-hauling company whose gasoline tanker truck  
>> lost a pair of wheels in San Francisco's Golden Gate Park last  
>> week said Wednesday they are stumped over what caused the  
>> dangerous mishap -- but they are investigating the possibility  
>> that someone tampered with the vehicle.
>>
>> The truck, which belongs to KAG West of West Sacramento, lost the  
>> left front wheels off the tanker on Park Presidio Drive the night  
>> of April 26, while it was heading for a Shell station with 8,600  
>> gallons of gas. San Francisco police didn't take a report because  
>> no one was hurt in the accident, but a Municipal Railway mechanic  
>> whose private car was hit by one of the tires, Michael Cheney,  
>> said all 10 lug nuts on the wheels had come off.
>>
>> Bruce Redmon, KAG West's safety director, said the 2-year-old  
>> truck had undergone a routine inspection that night before leaving  
>> the company's fueling terminal in Martinez. The inspection  
>> included checking the lug nuts on all the wheels, Redmon said.
>>
>> "They (the trucks) are checked daily, and this was no exception,''  
>> Redmon said.
>>
>> He said he'd been in the trucking business 30 years and this was  
>> the first time he'd ever heard of a set of tanker wheels simply  
>> falling off. He said he couldn't predict how long the  
>> investigation will take to complete.
>>
>> "It could be today, or 30 days from today, because we want the  
>> conclusion to be correct,'' he said. As for the possibility of  
>> tampering, he said: "There is a chance.''
>>
>> Cheney, who works on Muni buses, said that in his opinion, the lug  
>> nuts did not appear to have been stripped. That suggests the nuts  
>> either weren't properly tightened or they were intentionally  
>> loosened, he said.
>>
>> So far, police have not gotten involved in the investigation. The  
>> police officers who responded to the accident were there to make  
>> sure the truck driver and the drivers of the two cars hit by the  
>> wheels exchanged information for insurance purposes, and to direct  
>> traffic around the scene. The California Highway Patrol, which  
>> regulates tanker trucks on the highways, was never called.
>>
>> Even though the incident happened on a state highway -- Park  
>> Presidio is part of Highway 1 -- "there has to be a fatality,  
>> injury or tow-away (for the CHP to become involved), and this did  
>> not comply with any of those,'' Redmon said.
>>
>> He said that both the driver and his company, which operates 225  
>> fuel trucks in California, Arizona and Nevada, have "an exemplary  
>> record.''
>>
>> CHP safety officials said a review of KAG West records shows the  
>> company's Martinez terminal received an "unsatisfactory'' report  
>> for what was described only as "inadequate repair equipment'' just  
>> after the firm acquired the facility from another operator in  
>> 2003. But the company was given a clean bill of health on a return  
>> visit four months later, and again last year.
>>
>> Highway Patrol records show that KAG West trucks have been issued  
>> 17 citations in California since Jan. 11, mostly for basic  
>> equipment violations. But according to Greg Bragg, manager of  
>> motor carrier safety for the CHP, given the number of trucks KAG  
>> West operates, "that level of citations is actually a very low  
>> rate.''
>>
>> All aboard: Everyone is working in overdrive to get the collapsed  
>> portion of the MacArthur Maze fixed -- and to get their share of  
>> political face time in as well.
>> And, from what we're told, the effort to generate attention is  
>> also generating a bit of friction within the Bay Area's heavily  
>> Democratic political family.
>>
>> Rep. Ellen Tauscher of Walnut Creek is arranging a big helicopter  
>> flyover of the accident scene Friday morning, with Caltrans  
>> Director Will Kempton, Rep. Barbara Lee of Oakland and Rep. James  
>> Oberstar of Minnesota, chairman of the House Transportation and  
>> Infrastructure Committee, along for the ride.
>>
>> Not to be outdone, Sen. Barbara Boxer is planning her own private  
>> briefing and tour Friday -- accompanied by U.S. Transportation  
>> Secretary Mary Peters and Caltrans' local boss, Bijan Sartipi.
>>
>> Boxer plans to finish late in the morning with a big media event  
>> near the maze, to which she has invited Gov. Arnold  
>> Schwarzenegger, San Francisco Mayor Gavin Newsom, Oakland Mayor  
>> Ron Dellums, Lee and Tauscher.
>>
>> And what about Tauscher's helicopter ride, departing from SFO at  
>> 10:15 a.m. -- less than an hour before the scheduled press  
>> conference?
>>
>> "We are not partaking in the helicopter tour,'' Boxer spokeswoman  
>> Natalie Ravitz said. "We are told we can survey the damage right  
>> there on the scene.''
>>
>> Fine, Tauscher's people insist. But just for the record, they say  
>> they were planning the maze flyover even before Sunday's collapse,  
>> as part of an effort to scrape up more federal dollars for Bay  
>> Area transit.
>>
>> Bottom line, said Tauscher spokesman Kevin Lawlor: "It's tough to  
>> get everyone together with their schedules, but hopefully we can  
>> at least get everyone in one place for the press conference.''
>>
>> No doubt, no doubt.
>>
>> EXTRA! Catch our Web page at www.SFGate.com/matierandross. Play  
>> the dancing George Bush caption contest. Vote for the best option  
>> for dealing with the MacArthur Maze mess. Check out the bricks and  
>> kisses in feedback. And read the Extra, Extra, Extra musings and  
>> insights of friends including Rich "Big Vinny'' Lieberman and The  
>> Chronicle's Carla Marinucci and Don "Bad Reporter" Asmussen.
>>
>> Chronicle columnists Phillip Matier and Andrew Ross regularly  
>> appear Sundays, Mondays and Wednesdays. Phil can be seen on CBS 5- 
>> TV morning and evening news. Matier can also be heard on KCBS  
>> radio Monday to Friday at 7:50 a.m. and 5:50 p.m. Got a tip? Call  
>> them at (415) 777-8815 or drop them an e-mail at  
>> matierandross@sfchronicle.com.

Subject: Re: [sfraves] The truth about 4/29

On 3 May 2007, dangrsmind@yahoo.com wrote:

> Actually, the use of tankers as in 4/29 and the GGP incident is a well 
> known scenario in security circles.
>
> People in the government have known about the possible use of gasoline 
> and chemical tankers as weapons for at least a decade, since a tanker 
> was used to attack an Air Force facility in Saudi Arabia in 1996.
>
> I won't elaborate here obviously, but I was involved in an online 
> discusison of some possible terrorist scenarios about a year ago. 
> The possibility of using tanker trucks to attack economic flows and 
> transportation routes was discussed during that conversation.
>
> The literature which I am aware of on this goes back at least a 
> decade, dating to the attack in Saudi Arabia.  I expect there are 
> earlier assessments in the classified world.
>
> When I see a tanker on the freeway, I get away from it.  Now you know 
> why.

I had firsthand experience of this sort of thing on an lonely interstate 
some years ago.  A semi ahead of our vehicle lost a wheel.  The wheel 
rolled down the highway a bit, finally heading off into the ditch.  It 
then continued on up a hill that was created by an overpass, flew over 
the highway that the overpass was created for and continued into the 
field on the other side.  Trucker had no idea anything happened (double 
wheeled axles you know.  The though that immediately came to mind was 
what if the scenario was one where the wheel came off on the other side 
of the truck and heading through the (non-walled) center median and head 
on into oncoming traffic?)

Yeah, this stuff does happen.

>
> Peace,
>
> Peter
>

> On May 3, 2007, at 9:20 AM, Philip.X.Diaz wrote:
>
>> fossil fuel monkey-wrenching.  look out.
>> 
>> 
>> On May 3, 2007, at 9:14 AM, Will Penna wrote:
>> 
>>> Mattier & Ross in this morning's SFChron: Seems that all 12 lugs on the 
>>> wheels of a tanker carrying 8600 gals of gas recently came off in Golden 
>>> Gate Park. Coincidence or conspiracy? You be the judge.
>>> 
>>> http://www.sfgate.com/cgi-bin/article.cgi?f=/c/a/2007/05/03/BAGFLPJME830.DTL
>>> 
>>> MATIER AND ROSS
>>> Owner of tanker that lost wheels in Golden Gate Park is investigating 
>>> accident
>>> Phillip Matier, Andrew Ross
>>> Thursday, May 3, 2007
>>> 
>>> Officials of the fuel-hauling company whose gasoline tanker truck lost a 
>>> pair of wheels in San Francisco's Golden Gate Park last week said 
>>> Wednesday they are stumped over what caused the dangerous mishap -- but 
>>> they are investigating the possibility that someone tampered with the 
>>> vehicle.
>>> 
>>> The truck, which belongs to KAG West of West Sacramento, lost the left 
>>> front wheels off the tanker on Park Presidio Drive the night of April 26, 
>>> while it was heading for a Shell station with 8,600 gallons of gas. San 
>>> Francisco police didn't take a report because no one was hurt in the 
>>> accident, but a Municipal Railway mechanic whose private car was hit by 
>>> one of the tires, Michael Cheney, said all 10 lug nuts on the wheels had 
>>> come off.
>>> 
>>> Bruce Redmon, KAG West's safety director, said the 2-year-old truck had 
>>> undergone a routine inspection that night before leaving the company's 
>>> fueling terminal in Martinez. The inspection included checking the lug 
>>> nuts on all the wheels, Redmon said.
>>> 
>>> "They (the trucks) are checked daily, and this was no exception,'' Redmon 
>>> said.
>>> 
>>> He said he'd been in the trucking business 30 years and this was the first 
>>> time he'd ever heard of a set of tanker wheels simply falling off. He said 
>>> he couldn't predict how long the investigation will take to complete.
>>> 
>>> "It could be today, or 30 days from today, because we want the conclusion 
>>> to be correct,'' he said. As for the possibility of tampering, he said: 
>>> "There is a chance.''
>>> 
>>> Cheney, who works on Muni buses, said that in his opinion, the lug nuts 
>>> did not appear to have been stripped. That suggests the nuts either 
>>> weren't properly tightened or they were intentionally loosened, he said.
>>> 
>>> So far, police have not gotten involved in the investigation. The police 
>>> officers who responded to the accident were there to make sure the truck 
>>> driver and the drivers of the two cars hit by the wheels exchanged 
>>> information for insurance purposes, and to direct traffic around the 
>>> scene. The California Highway Patrol, which regulates tanker trucks on the 
>>> highways, was never called.
>>> 
>>> Even though the incident happened on a state highway -- Park Presidio is 
>>> part of Highway 1 -- "there has to be a fatality, injury or tow-away (for 
>>> the CHP to become involved), and this did not comply with any of those,'' 
>>> Redmon said.
>>> 
>>> He said that both the driver and his company, which operates 225 fuel 
>>> trucks in California, Arizona and Nevada, have "an exemplary record.''
>>> 
>>> CHP safety officials said a review of KAG West records shows the company's 
>>> Martinez terminal received an "unsatisfactory'' report for what was 
>>> described only as "inadequate repair equipment'' just after the firm 
>>> acquired the facility from another operator in 2003. But the company was 
>>> given a clean bill of health on a return visit four months later, and 
>>> again last year.
>>> 
>>> Highway Patrol records show that KAG West trucks have been issued 17 
>>> citations in California since Jan. 11, mostly for basic equipment 
>>> violations. But according to Greg Bragg, manager of motor carrier safety 
>>> for the CHP, given the number of trucks KAG West operates, "that level of 
>>> citations is actually a very low rate.''
>>> 
>>> All aboard: Everyone is working in overdrive to get the collapsed portion 
>>> of the MacArthur Maze fixed -- and to get their share of political face 
>>> time in as well.
>>> And, from what we're told, the effort to generate attention is also 
>>> generating a bit of friction within the Bay Area's heavily Democratic 
>>> political family.
>>> 
>>> Rep. Ellen Tauscher of Walnut Creek is arranging a big helicopter flyover 
>>> of the accident scene Friday morning, with Caltrans Director Will Kempton, 
>>> Rep. Barbara Lee of Oakland and Rep. James Oberstar of Minnesota, chairman 
>>> of the House Transportation and Infrastructure Committee, along for the 
>>> ride.
>>> 
>>> Not to be outdone, Sen. Barbara Boxer is planning her own private briefing 
>>> and tour Friday -- accompanied by U.S. Transportation Secretary Mary 
>>> Peters and Caltrans' local boss, Bijan Sartipi.
>>> 
>>> Boxer plans to finish late in the morning with a big media event near the 
>>> maze, to which she has invited Gov. Arnold Schwarzenegger, San Francisco 
>>> Mayor Gavin Newsom, Oakland Mayor Ron Dellums, Lee and Tauscher.
>>> 
>>> And what about Tauscher's helicopter ride, departing from SFO at 10:15 
>>> a.m. -- less than an hour before the scheduled press conference?
>>> 
>>> "We are not partaking in the helicopter tour,'' Boxer spokeswoman Natalie 
>>> Ravitz said. "We are told we can survey the damage right there on the 
>>> scene.''
>>> 
>>> Fine, Tauscher's people insist. But just for the record, they say they 
>>> were planning the maze flyover even before Sunday's collapse, as part of 
>>> an effort to scrape up more federal dollars for Bay Area transit.
>>> 
>>> Bottom line, said Tauscher spokesman Kevin Lawlor: "It's tough to get 
>>> everyone together with their schedules, but hopefully we can at least get 
>>> everyone in one place for the press conference.''
>>> 
>>> No doubt, no doubt.
>>> 
>>> EXTRA! Catch our Web page at www.SFGate.com/matierandross. Play the 
>>> dancing George Bush caption contest. Vote for the best option for dealing 
>>> with the MacArthur Maze mess. Check out the bricks and kisses in feedback. 
>>> And read the Extra, Extra, Extra musings and insights of friends including 
>>> Rich "Big Vinny'' Lieberman and The Chronicle's Carla Marinucci and Don 
>>> "Bad Reporter" Asmussen.
>>> 
>>> Chronicle columnists Phillip Matier and Andrew Ross regularly appear 
>>> Sundays, Mondays and Wednesdays. Phil can be seen on CBS 5-TV morning and 
>>> evening news. Matier can also be heard on KCBS radio Monday to Friday at 
>>> 7:50 a.m. and 5:50 p.m. Got a tip? Call them at (415) 777-8815 or drop 
>>> them an e-mail at matierandross@sfchronicle.com.

X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: Re: [sfraves] The truth about 4/29

This reminds me of an accident I saw on the Bay Bridge, eastbound.  About mid-span, I saw a car that had smacked into the right wall, and was missing a wheel.  Another driver had stopped to help the person, so I kept going, thinking "geez... that sucks.  I wonder what happened..".

Then I get all the way out to the opening of the tunnel, and I notice there's something rolling along next to me, going about the same 65mph I was going.  

..it was the wheel.  Just cruising along, perfectly straight, even following the curve of the road, somehow.  I obviously got the hell out of the way- the thing could have hit a misplaced pebble and gone flying into my window, with the inertia it had, but it just kept going, finally curving gracefully into the bus-only lane just before the west grand exit.  It was one of the more surreal sights I've seen in a while.

Freaky shit...
-G

----- Original Message ----
From: J.C. <dougm@kzsu.stanford.edu>

I had firsthand experience of this sort of thing on an lonely interstate 
some years ago.  A semi ahead of our vehicle lost a wheel.  The wheel 
rolled down the highway a bit, finally heading off into the ditch.  It 
then continued on up a hill that was created by an overpass, flew over 
the highway that the overpass was created for and continued into the 
field on the other side.  Trucker had no idea anything happened (double 
wheeled axles you know.  The though that immediately came to mind was 
what if the scenario was one where the wheel came off on the other side 
of the truck and heading through the (non-walled) center median and head 
on into oncoming traffic?)

Yeah, this stuff does happen.

Subject: Re: [sfraves] The truth about 4/29

Huh-

I would think that this tactic wouldn't work so well.
Any teenager with $50 and a bit of chemistry can build a device large  
enough to stick to the side of a tanker, rupture it, and ignite it.
But what is the damage done?
Driving through a fireball @ 70mph is not even a source of stress.
Much more dangerous is the chance of hitting the truck/trailer that  
has now overturned.
So- a normal truck, loaded with a bunch of big pipes or something  
would be a more effective weapon against soft human targets in their  
cars.
Gasoline and most other liquified chemicals in tanker trucks don't  
provide their own oxygen and do not detonate- they burn, rather than  
explode.
To get a good explosion out of these things you need to BLEVE them-
This is when- say- a rail car filled with gas overturns and sprouts a  
small leak at the top-
A little gas comes out and burns, but because it's overturned that  
little fire goes up- and weakens one area of the metal the tank is  
made of, simultaneously heating up the contents of the tank.
It'll sit like that for an hour- weakening the metal, building up  
internal pressure...
Then when the pressure and the weakness meet in some sort of unholy  
coup de grace, hell breaks loose and the shit hits the fan.
These are among the largest non-nuclear explosions that mankind has  
ever produced.

In summary- see a tanker truck roll over, tear itself apart, and  
burst in to flame?
Keep driving.
See a tanker truck rolled over, still intact, with a small fire?
RUN LIKE FUCKING HELL

--
"Jupiter accepts your offer..."
AIM:IMFDUP

> On May 3, 2007, at 9:14 AM, Will Penna wrote:
>
>> Mattier & Ross in this morning's SFChron: Seems that all 12 lugs on
>> the wheels of a tanker carrying 8600 gals of gas recently came off
>> in Golden Gate Park. Coincidence or conspiracy? You be the judge.
>>
>> http://www.sfgate.com/cgi-bin/article.cgi?f=/c/a/2007/05/03/
>> BAGFLPJME830.DTL
>>
>> MATIER AND ROSS
>> Owner of tanker that lost wheels in Golden Gate Park is
>> investigating accident
>> Phillip Matier, Andrew Ross
>> Thursday, May 3, 2007
>>
>> Officials of the fuel-hauling company whose gasoline tanker truck
>> lost a pair of wheels in San Francisco's Golden Gate Park last week
>> said Wednesday they are stumped over what caused the dangerous
>> mishap -- but they are investigating the possibility that someone
>> tampered with the vehicle.
>>
>> The truck, which belongs to KAG West of West Sacramento, lost the
>> left front wheels off the tanker on Park Presidio Drive the night
>> of April 26, while it was heading for a Shell station with 8,600
>> gallons of gas. San Francisco police didn't take a report because
>> no one was hurt in the accident, but a Municipal Railway mechanic
>> whose private car was hit by one of the tires, Michael Cheney, said
>> all 10 lug nuts on the wheels had come off.
>>
>> Bruce Redmon, KAG West's safety director, said the 2-year-old truck
>> had undergone a routine inspection that night before leaving the
>> company's fueling terminal in Martinez. The inspection included
>> checking the lug nuts on all the wheels, Redmon said.
>>
>> "They (the trucks) are checked daily, and this was no exception,''
>> Redmon said.
>>
>> He said he'd been in the trucking business 30 years and this was
>> the first time he'd ever heard of a set of tanker wheels simply
>> falling off. He said he couldn't predict how long the investigation
>> will take to complete.
>>
>> "It could be today, or 30 days from today, because we want the
>> conclusion to be correct,'' he said. As for the possibility of
>> tampering, he said: "There is a chance.''
>>
>> Cheney, who works on Muni buses, said that in his opinion, the lug
>> nuts did not appear to have been stripped. That suggests the nuts
>> either weren't properly tightened or they were intentionally
>> loosened, he said.
>>
>> So far, police have not gotten involved in the investigation. The
>> police officers who responded to the accident were there to make
>> sure the truck driver and the drivers of the two cars hit by the
>> wheels exchanged information for insurance purposes, and to direct
>> traffic around the scene. The California Highway Patrol, which
>> regulates tanker trucks on the highways, was never called.
>>
>> Even though the incident happened on a state highway -- Park
>> Presidio is part of Highway 1 -- "there has to be a fatality,
>> injury or tow-away (for the CHP to become involved), and this did
>> not comply with any of those,'' Redmon said.
>>
>> He said that both the driver and his company, which operates 225
>> fuel trucks in California, Arizona and Nevada, have "an exemplary
>> record.''
>>
>> CHP safety officials said a review of KAG West records shows the
>> company's Martinez terminal received an "unsatisfactory'' report
>> for what was described only as "inadequate repair equipment'' just
>> after the firm acquired the facility from another operator in 2003.
>> But the company was given a clean bill of health on a return visit
>> four months later, and again last year.
>>
>> Highway Patrol records show that KAG West trucks have been issued
>> 17 citations in California since Jan. 11, mostly for basic
>> equipment violations. But according to Greg Bragg, manager of motor
>> carrier safety for the CHP, given the number of trucks KAG West
>> operates, "that level of citations is actually a very low rate.''
>>
>> All aboard: Everyone is working in overdrive to get the collapsed
>> portion of the MacArthur Maze fixed -- and to get their share of
>> political face time in as well.
>> And, from what we're told, the effort to generate attention is also
>> generating a bit of friction within the Bay Area's heavily
>> Democratic political family.
>>
>> Rep. Ellen Tauscher of Walnut Creek is arranging a big helicopter
>> flyover of the accident scene Friday morning, with Caltrans
>> Director Will Kempton, Rep. Barbara Lee of Oakland and Rep. James
>> Oberstar of Minnesota, chairman of the House Transportation and
>> Infrastructure Committee, along for the ride.
>>
>> Not to be outdone, Sen. Barbara Boxer is planning her own private
>> briefing and tour Friday -- accompanied by U.S. Transportation
>> Secretary Mary Peters and Caltrans' local boss, Bijan Sartipi.
>>
>> Boxer plans to finish late in the morning with a big media event
>> near the maze, to which she has invited Gov. Arnold Schwarzenegger,
>> San Francisco Mayor Gavin Newsom, Oakland Mayor Ron Dellums, Lee
>> and Tauscher.
>>
>> And what about Tauscher's helicopter ride, departing from SFO at
>> 10:15 a.m. -- less than an hour before the scheduled press  
>> conference?
>>
>> "We are not partaking in the helicopter tour,'' Boxer spokeswoman
>> Natalie Ravitz said. "We are told we can survey the damage right
>> there on the scene.''
>>
>> Fine, Tauscher's people insist. But just for the record, they say
>> they were planning the maze flyover even before Sunday's collapse,
>> as part of an effort to scrape up more federal dollars for Bay Area
>> transit.
>>
>> Bottom line, said Tauscher spokesman Kevin Lawlor: "It's tough to
>> get everyone together with their schedules, but hopefully we can at
>> least get everyone in one place for the press conference.''
>>
>> No doubt, no doubt.
>>

>> dealing with the MacArthur Maze mess. Check out the bricks and
>> kisses in feedback. And read the Extra, Extra, Extra musings and
>> insights of friends including Rich "Big Vinny'' Lieberman and The
>> Chronicle's Carla Marinucci and Don "Bad Reporter" Asmussen.

nation.

>Especially in the face of no violent behavior exhibited by the  
>protesters.

My problem with the situation is the aggression towards a peaceful
demonstration and infringing on the right to assemble and what looks
like an attempt to muzzle the press.

Here's a 'citizen' journalist take on it by a guy who was at the
park, that imo, is definitely worth watching:
http://www.gamejew.com/?q=node/67

The police say there was a small group of people (young men?) that
started agitating the police, but apparently the police moved that
small group towards the park and then started pushing those persons
and everyone else out of the park.

IMO, they should have just dealt with the persons that were allegedly
causing issues and left everyone else alone.

hispanic reporters from Fox11 News, one of whom was
grabbed from behind and shoved while she was trying to
protect her camera woman, and the other who was shot
with a rubber bullet while logging a report, and
on-scene reporters from disturbingly right-wing talk
radio station KFI).

Bratton initially released a statement that the cops
acted the way they did because they were being
assaulted by "missiles" coming from the crowd.  Later
questioning revealed those "missiles" to be bottles. 
Further questioning revealed those "bottles" to be
small plastic water bottles, many of which were empty.

A big thing to learn here is that LAPD considers tear
gas, rubber bullets and nightstick shampoos as
reasonable response to someone throwing an empty
plastic drinking water bottle in their direction.  

My best advice is that if you're even in a situation
where you find yourself near LAPD, do what I do and
turn around and go in the opposite direction at a
rapid pace.

Subject: Re: [sfraves] LAPD fires rubber bullets into immigration protest crowd

------=_Part_39933_32135422.1178233870384
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=ISO-8859-1; format=flowed
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit
Content-Disposition: inline

whoa, hold on there a second.  To jump to the conclusion that anyone who
supports deportation of illegal immigrants or strict limits and enforcement
on immigration is racist really is non-sequitur.  Have you considered that
someone could want illegal immigrants punished as criminals because, under
the law of the land, they are in fact criminals?  That's no different than
desiring the enforcement of law in general, and is hardly a fault.

I'm originally from Houston, TX, the third largest city in the US by
population.  There are now more hispanics living in the city than whites,
many of whom are perfectly legal.  Most of the illegal workers don't cause
problems, though there is a higher crime rate in predominately hispanic
neighborhoods than in predominantly white and asian neighborhoods.  I know
firsthand, as I'm sure many people here and any inhabitants of L.A. also do,
how massive the impact to the workforce would be if every illegal hispanic
were deported.  These people maintain our roads and utilities, take out our
garbage, build our buildings, and give $3 haircuts from their unlicensed
salon that are often better than the $30 haircut down the road, to name a
few things.  Having seen and lived with all this, I have something of a
mixed view about the situation as a whole.

Importantly, I want to make it abundantly clear that I think the terms of
labor for many immigrants is terrible and wrong, and I think it is the moral
duty of the law to protect the rights of all workers, legal and illegal.  A
starvation wage for dangerous work is never appropriate in a society that
can easily afford to pay workers more.  Sadly, these conditions are still
vastly better than the opportunities in many immigrants' native lands, so
they continue to come across the border and endure mistreatment and
underpayment as workers.  But this doesn't mean that labor abuse is
justified.

The other side of the coin is the impact that massive and unregulated
immigration would have on the economy and actual Citizens of the US.  Face
it: the government of the US has a higher responsibility to rule in the
interests of its own citizens than it does to providing opportunity to the
citizens of other countries.  Indeed, after a fashion nearly everyone on
this continent can be considered an immigrant at some point in history, but
citizenship remains a clear and valid delineation as far as determining
responsibility of a government.  A healthy immigrant population is good for
the country, as it does provide a vital source of labor, but excessive
immigration won't be supportable.  There is a finite amount of work
available, but unlimited potential for population growth if we simply open
the borders, and eventually you reach a critical point where immigrants
cease to be a benefit.

I don't claim to have an answer to the problem.  But I do have a very hard
time being labeled as Racist because I think that unregulated, illegal
immigration should be stopped, and that some penalty should exist for people
who commit crimes even though the law in question badly needs reform.

My $0.02

oh and I forgot to mention, I think the actions of the police were generally
unwarranted.  They should have isolated the problematic protestors but left
the rest of the group in peace.  The police were also in no danger and had
no cause for special urgency, so their violence towards people who couldn't
get out of the way fast enough, be it a member of the press or just someone
weighed down by a flag, is particularly wrong.

Subject: Re: [sfraves] LAPD fires rubber bullets into immigration protest crowd

So put blame squarely on the shoulders of the folks who exploit these 
illegal workers. If companies in the USA didn't hire them and there was no 
money to be made, do you think they'd still come en masse? They come here 
for work, for opportunities to make money, to better their lives...kinda 
like the people who founded this country.

So go ahead and charge every farm/horse farm/construction 
company/landscaping company, etc. that hires these people...do you think 
that'd go over too well? Do you have any idea of the negative impact that 
would have on our country's economy???

See - it's not just as cut and dry as "get all them' thar illegals out o' my 
country!"

I don't advocate us just letting in folks willy nilly for the record - but 
when people try and push the whole "illegal immigrants are terrorists" 
bullshit (how many people from 9/11 were Mexican?) or that they "suck up all 
our resources" (kinda like illegal wars in the middle east sucks up our 
resources) - it just gets under my skin.

Subject: Re: [sfraves] LAPD fires rubber bullets into immigration protest crowd

------=_Part_41667_13569.1178242810636
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=ISO-8859-1; format=flowed
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit
Content-Disposition: inline

Did I say anything different than what you said in your first paragraph?  I
didn't blame immigrants for wanting to come (because there is money here),
and I also denounced unfair exploitation of workers.  Arresting everyone who
employs them isn't the answer, but I also never claimed that blanket
deportation is good either.

You have to remember, though, that even if there isn't all that much money,
or opportunity, for additional workers that are not already here, immigrants
will still want to come here if they're able because their perception of the
country won't reflect the economic reality.  Excessive immigration will, at
some point, become a problem once the labor available is massively greater
than the demand for work.  I'm not being a bigot and saying "them illegals
is sucking up our resources," because the same problems would arise out of
massive unemployment no matter what the citizenship or nationality of the
unemployed.  It seems to me that there is danger in artificially inflating
the unemployment rate via unregulated immigration, but the danger is the
same as a naturally growing unemployment rate.  Our government does, I
think, have a clear responsibility to prevent negative consequences to the
economy arising from immigration, which means that a balance needs to be
found between the benefits of immigrant labor and the need to maintain a
stable unemployment rate (which is damn hard to do, which is why we still
have problems).

Maybe I'm misinterpreting your statement and reply.  But I feel that I'm
being called a bigot, or lumped in with bigots, when even someone who
disagrees with my conclusions can see that racial hatred is no part of my
rational process at all.  I'd love to be told I'm incorrect in this regard.

On 5/3/07, Van Mundegaarde <electrofunk138@hotmail.com> wrote:
>
> So put blame squarely on the shoulders of the folks who exploit these
> illegal workers. If companies in the USA didn't hire them and there was no
> money to be made, do you think they'd still come en masse? They come here
> for work, for opportunities to make money, to better their lives...kinda
> like the people who founded this country.
>
> So go ahead and charge every farm/horse farm/construction
> company/landscaping company, etc. that hires these people...do you think
> that'd go over too well? Do you have any idea of the negative impact that
> would have on our country's economy???
>
> See - it's not just as cut and dry as "get all them' thar illegals out o'
> my
> country!"
>
> I don't advocate us just letting in folks willy nilly for the record - but
> when people try and push the whole "illegal immigrants are terrorists"
> bullshit (how many people from 9/11 were Mexican?) or that they "suck up
> all
> our resources" (kinda like illegal wars in the middle east sucks up our
> resources) - it just gets under my skin.

> >From: "Matthew Johnson" <prayformojo524@gmail.com>
